#<A># or (before vowels) AN:
     I This article has no equiv. in Sanskrit and is expressed by the singular number alone: there is a large silk-cotton tree on the banks of the Godavari %<asti godÃvarÅtÅre viÓÃla÷ ÓÃlmalÅtaru÷>% H. i.; there was a king named Cintamani %<abhÆdrÃjÃ cintÃmaïirnÃma>% Va.
     II But %<kaÓcit>% (%<kÃcit ki¤cit>%) should be added when special attention is directed to the object: a (certain) Yaksha %<kaÓcid yak«a÷>%, Me. I 1.; A (certain) saint named Marichi %<kaÓcinmarÅcirnÃbha bhahar«i÷>%, D. iii.
     III When it means a species of, %<viÓe«a÷ bheda÷>%, etc. should be added: Asoka is a tree %<aÓoko v­k«aviÓe«a÷>%.
     IV When used distributively, (a) expr. by avy. comp. with %<prati>%, or, by the repetition of the word in proper agreement with the verb: give (me) 500 sovereign a day %<pratyahaæ suvarïapa¤caÓatÃni dehi>%, H. iii; (b) the simple gen. may be used in connection with num. adverbs: dinner twice a day %<dvirahno bhojanam>%, V. In O. E. sometimes=on, in, for: q. v.: the world runs awheel %<*cakrairjagaddhÃvati>%.

     I Perfect: q. v.:
     1 %<nitya÷>% (%<tyÃ tyaæ>%) (=eternal, sometimes used with the same force): it is admitted by all assertors of final emancipation that it is a. %<nityaÓca mok«a÷ sarvairmÅk«avÃdibhirupagamyate>%, S. I. 4.;

#<AS>#:
     I As a particle of comparison:
     1 %<vat>% affixed, (he who looks on) other's wives as mothers, on other's things as clods %<mÃt­vat paradÃre«u paradravye«u lo«Âravat>%, H. i.; as before %<pÆrvavat>%;
     2 %<yathÃ>% (either in comp. to expr. sim. comparison, or with %<tathÃ>% or %<evaæ>% to expr. as......so...... also to introduce illustrations): as ordered %<yathÃnideÓaæ>%; as prescribed %<yathÃvidhi>%; as before %<yathÃpurÃ>%, Sa. vi.; as eating is inferred from nourishment or country from its language, so is knowable inferred from knowledge, %<yathÃ pu«ÂayÃ bhojanamanumÅyate yathÃ ca bhÃ«ayÃ deÓa÷ tathÃ j¤ÃnÃkÃreïa j¤eyamanumeyam>%. D. s. (see also R. iii. 23 and notice the repetition of %<yathÃ>% in such cases); as animals attempt to fly away when they see men with sticks, so.... %<yathÃ paÓvÃdaya÷ daï¬odyatakaraæ purÆ«amabhimukhamupalabhya palÃyitumÃrabhante evaæ.>%. S. i. p.; as for instance, fire is inferred from smoke %<yathÃ dhÆmenÃgniriti>%, N. d. As for instance: sometimes expr. by %<tathÃhi÷>% he, as a rule, enjoyed the pleasures of youth as for instance, sometimes roamed over artificial mountains, sometimes walked through summer houses %<sa prÃyaÓo yauvanasukhamanubabhÆva tathÃhi kadÃcit krÅ¬Ãparvate«u vicacÃra kadÃcillatÃg­he«u babhrÃma>%, K. II. While: expr. by the pres. part: as he went, he thought %<vrajaæÓca samarthayÃmÃsa>%, K. III. Since, in as much as: q. v.:
     1 by the abl. and when the subs. ends in %<tÃ>% or %<Ã>% by the ins.: as the motion of the vessels (at sea) depends on wind %<vÃtÃdhÅnapotagamanatvÃt>%, K. b.; as there was much political work %<rÃjakÃryasya bahulatayÃ>% Sa. vi.;
     2 %<yata÷...tata÷.>%. Miscell: as long as one lives %<yÃvajjÅvaæ>%; as far as the ocean %<Ã samudrÃt>%; as high as the knee %<jÃnudaghna÷>% (%<ghnÃ ghnaæ>%); as yet %<adyÃpi>%. N. B. as, when it connects two subs. s in apposition is expr. by %<bhÆtvÃ>% or %<k­tvÃ>%: I will remain as your queen %<tava mahi«Å bhÆtvÃ ti«ÂhÃmi>%; sent me to you as his agent %<mÃæ pratinidhiæ k­tvÃ tvatsakÃÓaæ prerayÃmÃsa>%.

#<NO># (adv.): %<na>%, no, no, become the ornament of my lap: %<na na madutsaÇgavibhÆ«aïaæ bhava>%, N. ix. 114.; and to say 'no, no' to one like you would be rebuking: %<na neti ca tvÃd­Ói vÃg vigarh­ïÃ>%, N. ix. 25.; to this we say 'no': %<atrocyate 'na'>%, S.; there is no greater fault than this: %<nÃta÷ parataro do«a÷>%, H. N.B. Use 'yes' in Sanskrit for 'no' after negative interrogation, 'has not this come to Chandragupta's ears? No, Sir: %<na khalu v­«alasya Óravaïamupagato'yaæ..Ãrya aya kim>%, Mu. iii.

#<OBJECT># (v.):

     I Denoting relation: expr. by gen. or tat. comp., daughter of the king of KÃsi: %<kÃÓirÃjaputrÅ>%, V.; speed of a chariot: %<rathasya vega÷>%, Sa.; conquest of Tripura: %<tripuravijaya÷>%, Me.      IV In partitive sense:

#<REASON># (subs.):
     I The intellect;
     1 %<viveka÷>% (good r.);
     2 %<buddhi÷>%: v. Intellect;
     3 %<mati÷>%: v. Mind;
     4 %<praj¤Ã>%: v. Wisdom;
     5 %<vyutpatti÷>%, of men endowed with r.: %<vyutpattimatÃæ puru«ÃïÃm>%, S. II. Ground, motive, cause:
     1 %<hetu÷>%, speaks of its r. s in the (following) SÆtras: %<atra hetÆnÃha sÆtrai÷>%, S. p. b.;
     2 %<kÃraïam>%: v. Cause;
     3 %<nimittam>% (= ground), say for what r.: %<kathaya kasminnimitte>%. Ph.: (a) for what r.: %<kinnimittam>%: v. Why; (b) without r.: %<akÃraïam nirarthakam>%, (c) by r. of by abl.: v.      III Argument:
     1 %<hetu÷>%, crushing the opponent's r. s: %<parapak«ahetÆnunmathya>%, S.;
     2 %<yukti÷>%, to prove some doctrine by mere r. s.: %<kevalÃbhiryu ktibhi÷ ka¤cit siddhÃntaæ sÃdhayitum>%, S.;
     3 %<upapatti÷>%, r. s have been forcibly adduced: %<upapattirudÃh­tÃ balÃt>%, Ki. ii. 28.
     IV Justice, propriety: q. v.

#<REASON># (v.):
     1 %<tarkayati vi->%, (%<tark>%, c. 10.);
     2 %<vicÃrayati>% (c. of %<car>%): v. To argue, debate. Ph.: r. ing faculty: %<dhÅÓakti÷>%: v. Reason (I).

#<REASONABLE>#:
